<summary>1. The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function and also to a method of mounting an elastic member therein, and is useful in applications mainly to vehicle traveling path joints in new transit systems, monorails and the like and besides, to road bed plate joints in road bridges, footbridges and the like.  
2. The invention comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxial built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.  
3. The present invention is adapted to prevent, by blocking up the expansion gap in a bridge girder joint with the joint block while permitting an expansion gap function to be maintained, the occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations for the achievement of smooth and safe vehicle traveling (see  FIG. 2 ).  
4. It will be appreciated that even in the occurrence of any displacement such as the vertical differences in level and/or the lateral displacements and besides, the kinked joints in the joints of the bridge girders especially due to the earthquake or the like, the joint block may be conditioned to be always in the center of the expansion gap thanks to elastic member deformation for the elimination and/or relief of the differences in level and/or the lateral displacements and the like, resulting in the achievement of smooth vehicle traveling without the need for any emergency measures involving the use of the steel sheets or the like.  
5. It will be appreciated also that the joint block is placed across the expansion gap, and thus, the adequate management of accuracy of each member if given may be adapted to prevent the differences in level from occurring in any joint portion between the joint block and the traveling path.  
6. It is noted that the use of a joint block made of the same concrete as that of the traveling path may be adapted to provide more substantially increased slip resistance to the tires, as compared with the rubber or steel expansion joint. It is noted also especially that a high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete joint block is as highly durable as hardly worn away, and is thus considered to be suitably applicable to the joint block for use in the present invention.  
7. The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice verse easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.

The present invention pertains to retaining walls, particularly to completely precast concrete retaining walls of the type typically used alongside highways and railways. The invention provides an apparatus and method for constructing such walls, which can be installed using pre-manufactured assembly components to save both installation and transportation costs. The walls can be designed to be taller and shorter than traditional retaining walls, and can be constructed using pre-manufactured assembly components, such as precast concrete face panels, countersforts, and base pieces. 2. The present invention provides an improved down hole heating system for use in conditioning oil and gas wells for increased flow, when such flow is impeded because of viscosity and/or paraffin blockage conditions.
3. <summary>Field of the Invention</summary>
The invention relates generally to downhole tools for conducting mechanical activities in wells, and more specifically, to a simply and efficiently operable mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore.

<summary>Background of the Invention</summary>
The subject matter hereof is related to the subject matter of U.S. Pat. No. 4,061,389 and is directed specifically to the improvement that promotes effective connection of a pull tool to a down hole object or fish and simple and effective disconnection of the pull tool from the article if such is desired. 

<summary>Background of the Invention</summary>
During drilling operations, well servicing operations, and the like, objects may become lost or stuck within a well bore and these objects are typically referred to in the industry as "fish." For example, a section of drill pipe or production tubing might become disconnected from a pipe string and it is then necessary to introduce a pull tool into the well bore, establish connection with the fish and then remove the fish. Many different types of pull tools, grap pling devices, spears, etc. have been developed for the purpose of conducting fishing operations in well bores. It is typical for wire line operations to be utilized for the purpose of introducing a pull tool into the well bore for fishing operations. 

<summary>Background of the Invention</summary>
In many cases, down hole devices are positioned within casing and tubing strings for the purpose of controlling well operations. In most cases, such down hole devices are equipped with API Standard fishing necks which normally include an undercut shoulder to enable grappling by standard installation and retrieval tools. Quite often the API Standard fishing neck will become corroded or eroded by well conditions to the point that only a stub pipe is exposed without the usual undercut shoulder that is provided on the fishing neck. Connection between a wire line controlled fishing tool and a worn fishing neck may be accomplished by means of an overshot type grappling device generally defined by a collet structure having internal teeth that establish a gripping relation with the worn fishing neck. Although overshot type retrieving tools are successfully utilized in many cases, a common problem with such tools is the inability of the operator to achieve disconnection from the worn fishing neck in the event the tool is unable to accomplish an effective pulling operation. Occasionally, disconnection can be achieved by a substantial jarring or other violent mechanical movement, but, in some cases

<summary>Position and Motion Sensors: A Comprehensive Overview</summary>
Position and motion sensors are essential for monitoring and controlling various mechanical systems, including internal combustion engines. These sensors generate electrical signals proportional to the distance between moving objects and a fixed reference point. The sensor monitoring system provides a method to multiplex multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires, reducing energy consumption and increasing efficiency. The sensor window reference circuit continuously compares the sensor output to the existing output, adjusting the output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal. The sensor generates a relatively small reference signal that is large enough to eliminate small values of drift in a negative going direction yet not generate a significant amount of signal due to the discrete nature of the calibration voltages from a DAC and counter combination. The sensor also includes a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit that constantly compares the sensor output to a desired minimum value and generates a correction signal to deliver a sensor signal output that is as close to the desired minimum as practical without requiring unnecessary circuitry.

<summary>Summary of the Present Invention</summary>

The present invention provides a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines that is substantially infinitely variable, desmodromic, and highly efficient. It eliminates the need for springs and reduces the mass inertia of the valve assembly, allowing for more efficient and effective power generation. The system is simple, robust, and can be easily controlled by computerized means. It is particularly advantageous for high-speed engines and can be used with multiple valves per cylinder.

Summary 1: The invention provides a light member for aquarium lighting that includes a housing with a top side and a bottom side, a lighting control region disposed on the bottom side of the housing, and a switch coupled to the housing. The switch is operable to control the first control channel, the second control channel, and the neutral channel. The light member also includes a light-emitting module sized and configured to be coupled to the lighting control region, the light-emitting module having an LED that emits a first color of light, the first light-emitting module further having a first electrical connector that couples to the first control channel, and a second light-emitting module sized and configured to be coupled to the lighting control region, the second light-emitting module having an LED that emits a second color of light, the second light-emitting module further having a second electrical connector that couples to the second control channel. The switch assembly is coupled to the housing and is operable to selectively deliver power to the first control channel and the second control channel. The invention also includes a dual in-line timer for controlling the light member. The invention provides a simple, manually controllable design for aquarium lighting that allows for variable functionality and output options.

<summary>Overview of the Invention</summary>

The present invention addresses the challenge of operating high-temperature gas turbines, where traditional cooling channels are cast and cast cores are complex, leading to high blade weight and centrifugal-force stresses. The invention proposes a cooled flow deflection apparatus for gas turbines, which avoids these drawbacks and is simple to produce, flexible for different applications, and efficiently cooled. Key features include:

1. <summary>Use of separate inserts for cooling channels</summary>
   - Separated cooling channels are inserted into the apparatus, facilitating assembly and securing.
   - Inserts are flat strips composed of metal or non-metal materials, reducing blade weight and stresses.

2. <summary>Efficient cooling through mutual opposite directions</summary>
   - Cooling fluid flows in mutually opposite directions in two adjacent cooling channels.
   - Deflection devices are used to ensure consistent flow.

3. <summary>Compact design for easy assembly</summary>
   - Separating walls are integrally formed in the interior of the apparatus, simplifying assembly and securing.
   - Inserts are securely seated, reducing centrifugal forces.

4. <summary>Flexibility for different applications</summary>
   - Suitable for rotating guide apparatuses and gas turbines.
   - Can be adapted for rotor blades operating at high speeds.

5. <summary>Efficient cooling system</summary>
   - Minimal heat transfer between the blade root and the separating walls.
   - Reduced thermal stresses and centrifugal forces.

6. <summary>Simple and secure seating</summary>
   - Secure seating for inserts is achieved by integral material joints.
   - Insert separation is achieved by soldering or welding.

7. <summary>Compact geometry for gas turbines</summary>
   - Blade geometry simplifies the cooling system.
   - Minimal blade weight and stresses.

8. <summary>Flexibility for rotor blades</summary>
   - Suitable for high-speed rotating blades.
   - Can be adapted for gas turbines operating at high speeds.

9. <summary>Efficient cooling for gas turbines</summary>
   - Minimized heat transfer between the blade root and the separating walls.
   - Reduced thermal stresses and centrifugal forces.

Summary 1: The present invention provides a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, which can be smoothly switched between manual and automatic control without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall. The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor, which automatically sets the throttle position for optimum performance. The control unit also provides an output signal which controls a clutch. The clutch connects the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve when manual control is desired. During manual control, the vehicle driver has full control of the vehicle. Changing control from automatic to manual, however, does not occur until the throttle valve is moved either to a predetermined position or is positioned to match what is commanded by the accelerator pedal. Thus, the vehicle is prevented from lurching forward or stalling when control is shifted from automatic to manual. 
Summary 2: The present invention also includes a system for controlling the operation of a continuously variable transmission as disclosed in applicant's pending and commonly assigned application Ser. Nos. 380,922  and 380,923 filed May 21, 1982, now U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,459,878 and 4,458,560, and which are incorporated herein by reference. At high transmission ratios, it is desirable to manually control the throttle valve position while at low transmission ratios, automatic control is preferred. The control system of the present invention may also be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission as disclosed in applicant's pending and commonly assigned application Ser. Nos. 380,922  and 380,923 filed May 21, 1982, now U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,459,878 and 4,458,560, and which are incorporated herein by reference.

<summary>Fluid Pump Design and Construction</summary>

1. The fluid pump described in the document is a pump that can pump liquids at high volumetric flow rates and high pressure, particularly for pumping liquid manure from a reservoir.
2. The pump is designed to be used in series, allowing fluid to be pumped from one pump head to the next in a series, ultimately being discharged from a final pump head.
3. The pump has two pump heads, each with three fluid conduits per pump head, allowing fluid to be combined into a single flow before exiting the pump head.
4. The pump is connected to a drive structure that commonly drives the impellers, allowing the impellers to be commonly driven by the drive structure.
5. The pump assembly is mounted on a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer, providing flexibility and modularity for installation and maintenance.
6. The pump is capable of pumping fluids at high volumetric flow rates and high pressure, tailored for applications such as animal husbandry operations.
7. The pump is designed to be constructed by simply stacking known pumps together, with the initial and final pump heads having different design features to permit fluid flow from one pump head to the other.
8. The pump is capable of pumping liquids at high volumetric flow rates and high pressure, with intermediate pump heads having design features of both the initial and final pump heads to permit series flow of fluid and common driving of the impellers.

The present invention relates to support structures for engines and associated gearboxes, particularly focusing on mounting links between engines and gearboxes. The key features include:

1. A mounting link between an engine and a gearbox that includes a male link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, a female link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, and a radial interface that dampens translation relative to the female link. The radial interface dampens translation relative to the female link, and a pin that selectively retains the male link and the female link.

2. A gearbox assembly that includes a gearbox and a link assembly to couple the engine to the gearbox, the link assembly including a male link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, a female link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, and a radial interface that dampens translation relative to the female link. The radial interface dampens translation relative to the female link, and a pin that selectively retains the male link and the female link.

3. The link assembly can be used to connect the engine to the gearbox, allowing for the transmission of torque and other loads. The link assembly can rigidly constrain one degree of freedom between the engine and the gearbox, preventing the gearbox from detaching from the engine or transmitting potentially destructive loads to the engine.

4. The link assembly can be used to connect the engine to the gearbox, allowing for the transmission of torque and other loads. The link assembly can rigidly constrain one degree of freedom between the engine and the gearbox, preventing the gearbox from detaching from the engine or transmitting potentially destructive loads to the engine.

1. The present invention provides an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that enhances the volumetric efficiency of the engine by utilizing the dynamic effects of the air flow.
2. The device comprises a tank defining a volume, a first pipe defining a first passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, and a second pipe defining a second passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage.
3. The first and second passages are open to the intake passage at different locations with respect to each other, and the cross-sectional area of the second passage is smaller than that of the first passage.
4. A valve is disposed in the first passage together with a valve actuating means responsive to an engine operating condition.
5. The valve is preferably positioned at the tank-side opening of the passage defined by pipe 5, and is actuated by an actuator 8 comprising a vacuum diaphragm actuator.
6. The valve is fixed to the diaphragm 8a by a valve rod 8c, and the apparatus has a vacuum chamber 8d defined by the diaphragm 8a and the casing 8b.
7. The compressed spring 8e urges the diaphragm 8a in the direction toward which the valve 7 is closed.
8. The valve 7 is opened against the spring 8e when the engine load is increased, and closed against the spring 8e when the engine load is decreased.
9. The present invention further includes a control valve 7 disposed at the tank-side opening of the passage defined by pipe 5, and is actuated by an actuator 8 comprising a vacuum diaphragm actuator.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

1. The invention proposes a method for compressing natural gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing the gas at least during individual intervals to a substantially higher pressure than the desired exit pressure, cooling the compressed gas by the heat exchange to a temperature above the exit temperature, and obtaining the further cooling to the desired exit temperature by expanding the gas from the excess pressure to the desired exit pressure. 

2. The invention starts from the fact that it is known to carry out the compression of a gas supplied at an entry pressure below the nominal pressure (rated pressure of the gas pipeline) to an increased pressure, wherein the compression can be carried out in a single stage or in multiple stages in compressors which are connected in series. Between the compressor stages and particularly after the last compressor stage, cooling by heat exchange takes place (usually air/gas heat exchange), in order to reach the required lower exit temperature of at most 0° C., preferably -5° C., for the re-entry of the compressed gas into the gas pipeline. 

3. During the warmer period of the year, in which the use of re-cooling units was necessary for ensuring the required exit temperature, the invention provides for a different type of cooling. The invention utilizes the known physical effect according to which a compressed gas is inevitably cooled when expanded to a lower pressure, either by throttling or with the simultaneous performance of work. In order to ensure the required exit pressure or nominal pressure at the exit of the compressor station, the invention provides that the gas to be transported is compressed to an excess pressure which is substantially above the exit pressure, for example, 10 to 50 bar above the exit pressure, to carry out at the end of the single-stage or multiple-stage compression a cooling by heat exchange, particularly by air/gas heat exchange, and subsequently to expand the compressed gas to the desired exit pressure. 

4. The invention starts from the fact that it is known to carry out the compression of a gas supplied at an entry pressure below the nominal pressure (rated pressure of the gas pipeline) to an increased pressure, wherein the compression can be carried out in a single stage or in multiple stages in compressors which are connected in series. The invention relates to a system and method for reducing exhaust emissions from internal combustion engines, particularly focusing on the use of water injection and water recovery systems to capture and recycle water from the exhaust gases, thereby minimizing the need for a radiator and reducing the overall exhaust temperature. The system and method include multiple cascading stages, each with downstream expansion cylinders that capture and recycle the exhaust gases, and a water injection system that injects water into the exhaust gases to cool them and capture the heat energy. The invention also includes a water recovery system that recovers the water from the crankcase and uses it to cool the expansion cylinders and improve the overall thermal-to-mechanical efficiency of the engine. The invention aims to reduce exhaust emissions and improve engine performance by minimizing the need for a radiator and by utilizing water injection and water recovery systems to capture and recycle water from the exhaust gases.

The invention discloses a rolling body guide cage with a ring element produced from a sheet metal material and having an axial profiling formed by forming techniques and several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction. The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, comprising two real triaxial magnetic field sensors and three pairs of compensation coils. The system includes a control unit with six inputs and six outputs for generating six virtual sensor signals and six control signals for six coils. The virtual sensor signals are calculated by averaging the real sensor signals, and the control signals are generated by multiplying the virtual sensor signals by a matrix. The feedback matrix is determined by applying a signal to the first compensation system and measuring the absorbed components of the sensor signals of the second system. The feedback matrix is used to adjust the control signals, resulting in homogeneous or inhomogeneous magnetic fields. The system is designed to compensate for inhomogeneous interfering fields and to equalize potential feedback effects between two compensation systems.

1. The present invention provides a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering (CARS) microscopy.
2. The method involves sensing a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering by excitation of at least one resonance site of the sample by means of laser irradiation.
3. The method comprises furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner.
4. The method is suitable for selective imaging of chemical structures containing resonance sites, enabling three-dimensional spatial resolution.
5. The method is advantageous for tagging in biological samples, such as nerve tissue, and for detecting specific structures based on natural origin.
6. The method is based on bioorthogonal chemical reactions and can be used in combination with CARS microscopy for enhanced detection of target sites.
7. The method is particularly suitable for selective accentuation of defined structures in a sample, enabling the detection of non-resonant background and improved image quality.
8. The method is advantageous for reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background in CARS microscopy, enhancing the reproducibility of CARS methods.

1. The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
2. The invention eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the design rule-checking tool.
3. The invention creates customized rules appropriate for different types of memory regions that might be included on a chip, where such customized rules are based on modifying a standard logic rule by "pushing" more liberal memory based parameter onto stricter logic based parameter.
4. The invention provides a system and method of checking design rules to determine whether or not a logic part (all non-memory devices that have to satisfy TLR) of a mask pattern data obeys logic rules (as specified in a TLR document) and the memory part of a mask pattern data obeys memory rules (in this case, logic rules that are modified appropriately for a memory area to accommodate the more liberal values available for such regions).
5. The invention provides a program that can be executed on any number of conventional computing systems for creating such customized rules and performing a design rule check on mask pattern data based on such customized rule sets.
6. The invention provides a system configured with the above mentioned customized design rules and programs executing on a conventional computer system.

The invention relates to waveguide holograms for illuminating objects with specific illumination requirements, particularly for display holograms and spatial light modulators. The invention includes a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, which provides extremely high diffraction efficiencies. Non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront in the direction of propagation can be compensated for by exposing a photographic emulsion to the beam without compensation. The invention also includes a method for selectively illuminating demanding objects, such as holograms and spatial light modulators, using thin substrate waveguides.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

1. The invention relates to a method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of squirrel cage rotors for induction motors, particularly focusing on the resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor to identify defects and manufacturing processes.
2. The invention includes a dynamoelectric machine rotor test apparatus that includes a test head for testing the rotor and a data acquisition, processing, and control system for acquiring and processing data from the rotor.
3. The test apparatus comprises a rotor test fixture that includes a test head and a retraction and drive mechanism for rotating the rotor within the test head.
4. The rotor test fixture includes a skew winding portion for sensing the effective electrical skew of the rotor.
5. The skew winding portion includes a skew pick-up coil for sensing the effective electrical skew of the rotor.
6. The skew pick-up coil is positioned in quadrature with the poles of the rotor and generates an effective skew signal responsive to flux build-up at the end of the rotor due to the rotor's effective skew.
7. The skew pick-up coil is coupled to a current sensor for sensing the current provided to energize the test head windings and coupling a current sense signal to the sample and hold circuit.
8. The sample and hold circuit is coupled to a data processor for processing the data from the skew pick-up coil and calculating resistance, reactance, and effective skew values.
9. The data processor generates statistical information and statistical analysis over multiple tests, including averages and standard deviation, to provide a comprehensive evaluation of the rotor's performance.

<summary>
1. The invention provides a novel implementation of a queue, particularly a FIFO-type queue (First In First Out), in a memory.
2. The solution in accordance with the invention is intended for use specifically in connection with functional memories.
3. The queue is implemented by means of a tree-shaped data structure in which the nodes have a given maximum size and (1) additions of data units (to the queue) are directed in the tree-shaped data structure to the first non-full node, seen from below, on the first edge of the data structure and (2) deletions of data units (from the queue) are also directed to a leaf node on the edge of the tree, typically on the opposite edge.
4. The tree-shaped data structure is termed a tree in the following.
5. When the solution in accordance with the invention is used, each update to be made in the functional environment requires a time and space that are logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue, since only the path leading from the root to the point of updating must be copied from the structure.
6. The node to be updated is easy to access, since the search proceeds by following the edge of the tree until a leaf node is found.
7. The header node in the structure also includes an identifier indicating in each case which of the separate nodes constitutes the beginning and which constitutes the end of the queue.
8. The queue can be inverted in constant time and constant space irrespective of the length of the queue, as long as the header node makes use of an identifier indicating in each case which of the separate nodes constitutes the beginning and which constitutes the end of the queue.
9. The header node makes use of an identifier indicating in each case which way the queue is interpreted in each case.
10. The queue can be inverted by changing the value of the identifier, and the tree structure will be interpreted as a mirror image.

1. The invention provides a method for determining feedback gains that permits determining the proper value of feedback gain both easily and accurately, in a short period of time and irrespective of the kind of the subject of control.
2. The method comprises a first step of provisionally determining a predetermined value of a feedback gain, a second step of executing feedback control by using the provisionally determined feedback gain, a third step of detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value of the subject of control during the execution of the second step, a fourth step of calculating an evaluation value indicative of the character of feedback control according to the error detected in the third step, a fifth step of executing the second to fourth steps repeatedly a plurality of times after provisionally determining a new feedback gain value different from the previous value, and a sixth step of calculating a feedback gain value which can provide for a suitable evaluation value according to the relation between the feedback gain value and the evaluation value obtained through the fifth step.
3. The method permits a feedback gain providing for a suitable evaluation value to be calculated on the basis of the relation between feedback gain value and evaluation value, and it is thus possible to determine a feedback gain which can realize a suitable feedback control characteristic quickly and reliably.
4. The method is applicable to cases of determining the proportional gain, the integral gain, and the differential gain, and the evaluation functions are suited for evaluating the optimum values of the P, I, and D gains.

<summary>Overview of the Imaging Device and Its Charging System</summary>

The imaging device discussed herein includes a black and white printing machine with a photoreceptor belt and a developer station. The device is designed to charge the toner to a predetermined level based on the inactivity period. The inactivity period is determined by the status of the printing operation, and the charging system adjusts the tribo charge of the toner to ensure a stable and consistent image quality. The charging system includes a TC sensor to monitor the concentration of the toner, and a calculating section to calculate the decay of the tribo charge based on the difference between sensor levels. The charging section charges the developer based on the calculated decay and pre-runs the machine to ensure the developer is at an adequate charge level for normal printing. The system is designed to be adaptable to various printing devices and can be implemented in software or hardware using standard logic circuits or VLSI design. The disclosed methods can be readily implemented in software, such as by using object or object-oriented software development environments. The disclosed intelligent toner charging system can be used to adjust the tribo charge of the toner, and variations of the system can be designed to accommodate different printing devices and applications.

Summary 1: The present invention provides a rotary magnetic head type apparatus capable of independently and precisely regulating bias currents supplied to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum in a simple structure. It enables independent and precise control of bias currents for MR heads, allowing the MR heads to be controlled with outputs from one-channel rotary transformer for control signals and the single decoder for digital-to-analog conversion. The invention also enables switching over among plural MR heads with high precision, in particular a rotary magnetic head type apparatus permitting switching over plural MR heads and recording heads mounted on a rotary drum at high speed.
Summary 2: The invention also enables switching over among plural heads with high precision, in particular a rotary magnetic head type apparatus permitting switching over plural MR heads and recording heads mounted on a rotary drum at high speed. It enables independent and precise control of bias currents for MR heads, allowing the MR heads to be controlled with outputs from one-channel rotary transformer for control signals and the single decoder for digital-to-analog conversion. The invention also enables switching over among plural MR heads with high precision, in particular a rotary magnetic head type apparatus permitting switching over plural MR heads and recording heads mounted on a rotary drum at high speed.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

1. The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, in the presence of an adjacent object.
2. The invention provides a system and method that improves substantially the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing of one concealed object, such as a buried pipe or cable, in the presence of an adjacent object.
3. The invention uses a transmitter and receiver system to detect and trace the presence of a cable (or pipe) in the presence of an adjacent cable.
4. The transmitter generates alternating currents in the cables to induce magnetic fields, which are sensed by a receiver to produce an output signal.
5. The receiver can sense both the magnetic fields associated with the currents in the cables, which are distinguishable and produce an output signal.
6. The invention eliminates the distortion of the output signal characteristic when a second cable is present adjacent to the first cable.
7. The invention can locate and trace one cable more easily and accurately than with prior art systems and methods.
8. The invention can produce two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables C and C', as shown in FIG. 6.
9. The invention can optimize the receiver's positioning and tracking of the transmitter when the receiver is moved to the position shown in FIG. 5 to trace the cable C.

1. The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to provide hands-free automatic answering and communication.
2. The apparatus includes a source of power for the interfacing apparatus, such as a transformer connected to a wall outlet in a home.
3. Selective switch means are provided for selectively connecting, when actuated, the interfacing apparatus with the telephone network to permit telephone operation in either a conventional manner or in an automatic answering mode.
4. When in the automatic answering mode, a coupler is provided for automatically coupling the telephone network to the speaker phone to receive incoming telephone calls on the speaker phone when the selector switch is actuated.

The present invention is a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplying energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables that also distribute communications signals.
2. The preferred embodiment of the present invention, generally indicated by the reference numeral 100, includes a ring topology with one or more telecommunications hub serially interconnected therein, a hub with remote pumping, and a hub without remote pumping.

8. The branch fiber optic cable is optically coupled to the hub, and the hub is optically coupled to the optical fiber cable trunk.

<summary>1. The present invention provides a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, which consists of as few parts as possible, is inexpensive to produce, operates reliably, and can easily be fitted to a monitor. 2. The light-shielding device is characterized by a number of annular strips concentrically nested and essentially enclosing one another in a tight manner, which strips are suitable to be fixed in front of a displaying screen and in that case surround the screen, said strips furthermore being suitable to slide over one another between a pushed-in position, in which they essentially cover one another, and a pushed-out position, in which they are essentially uncovered. 3. The strips of the light-shielding device are provided with hook elements or locking elements to ensure reliable folding-in and folding-out of the light-shielding device. 4. The invention provides an adapter member providing a flat attachment face for the light-shielding device. Thus, by using the adapter member, the light-shielding device, which usually requires a flat attachment face, can be fixed to virtually any type of monitor, with either a flat or a single- or double-curved front. 5. The strips can be of solid design, for example produced by injection-moulding, but may also be produced by bending plate material, preferably provided with integrated hook or locking elements. 6. The present invention provides a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, which consists of as few parts as possible, is inexpensive to produce, operates reliably, and can easily be fitted to a monitor.</summary>

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

1. The present invention addresses the problem of automatically informing a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when that rate is likely to be greater than a rate that a listener can comprehend.
2. The invention utilizes acoustic and semantic clarity to determine a speaking rate threshold, which is based on a listening rate of the listener.
3. The invention includes a method for increasing comprehension by detecting a speaker's rate of speech, comparing the speaking rate to a listening rate, and warning the speaker to slow down when the speaking rate exceeds the listening rate.
4. The invention can be implemented in various aspects, including automated methods for facilitating understanding between discourse participants, methods for facilitating comprehension during a discourse bed, and devices for facilitating understanding between discourse participants.
5. The invention can be used in telephony, voice networks, and other contexts where speech is communicated.
6. The invention can be integrated into wearable computing devices, such as smart phones, to provide a new speaking rate detection and notification capability.
7. The invention can be used in conjunction with other technologies, such as speech analysis, video analysis, and other technologies to identify and profile listeners.
8. The invention can be used to improve comprehension in various contexts, including face-to-face conversations, telephone calls, and web-based interactions.

The device comprises a cyclic line counter, which carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses respectively, N/p being an integer >1, the end-of-count pulse being applied to the beam suppression circuit of the TV camera for picture beam suppression.

Summary 1:
The present invention provides a content synchronization framework that allows connected devices, such as personal computers, portable computers, and other devices, to perform contextual synchronization over a wide variety of communication network topologies, including both wired and wireless connections. The framework supports dynamic attributes and file bundles, enabling the synchronization of content from connected devices to a central reference point. It employs data compression and concurrent priority-based downloading to optimize communication bandwidth and improve efficiency. The framework is scalable, deployable worldwide, and supports both synchronous and asynchronous interactions between the central reference point and connected devices. It also provides flexibility to support content synchronization at any point in time based on device context, including arbitrary dynamic attributes and bundle information.

Summary 1:
The present invention overcomes the disadvantages of prior systems by providing a timely and anonymous communication channel between a finder of an object and an owner of the object. The system allows for a finder to anonymously communicate with the owner without revealing personal information or contact details, while still providing access to the object's location and return instructions. The system also includes a virtual locale feature that enables the finder to communicate with the owner in a secure and anonymous manner, even if the owner is traveling or has recently moved.

1. The invention is a foil electron multiplier, which uses a sequential series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages.
2. The foil electron multiplier has N foils and a resistor divider between each foil with an applied voltage V APP, for N>1, such that the potential between individual stages is V S =V APP /(N−1).
3. The foil electron multiplier is defined as having N stages resulting from impact of a particle with the first stage, and can generate secondary electrons at each stage.

1. The preferred embodiment of the 3-D Phenomenoscope utilizes a simple algorithm to identify and synchronize the lateral motion in the motion picture.
2. The algorithm uses an intensity edge finding algorithm to detect vertical edges in the foreground of the motion picture and identify a single prominent vertical edge.
3. The algorithm then compares this vertical edge to detect lateral motion in the sequential frames of the motion picture.
4. The preferred embodiment uses a simple algorithm to identify the direction of lateral motion and synchronize the darkness of the right and left lenses to the foreground lateral motion.
5. The algorithm tracks the speed of motion and direction of motion across several frames to determine synchronization events.
6. The preferred embodiment uses a multiplicity of different lens control algorithms to detect motion and adjust the state of the viewer glasses based on the identified synchronization events.
7. The algorithm can detect and correct for head movement by tracking the picture enclosing rectangle and accounting for detected motion.

<summary>Summary of the Present Invention</summary>

1. The present invention relates to the dicing of semiconductor devices, specifically focusing on the mechanical separation of individual die from a wafer using pressure to create clean breaks along the scribe lines.
2. The invention includes forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and applying a mechanical pressure to singulate the individual die.
3. The apparatus comprises a pad for supporting the wafer and a positioning member to position the wafer on the pad.
4. The pressure mechanism applies mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate the individual die.
5. The apparatus can be used for dicing semiconductor wafers without the use of a wafer saw.
6. The method involves forming trenches along the scribe lines, applying pressure, and singulating the individual die.
7. The invention can be used for dicing semiconductor wafers with thousands of die and dozens or hundreds of scribe lines.
8. The process is particularly useful for dicing semiconductor wafers with thin wafers, such as those used in cell phones or other applications.
9. The method can be used for dicing semiconductor wafers with back-grinding, reducing the thickness of the wafer after back-grinding.
10. The invention can be applied to any type of semiconductor chip, including memory, logic, analog, microprocessor, MOS, bipolar, and others.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

1. The present invention addresses the limitations of field emission display devices, particularly focusing on reducing burnout damage to field emission elements due to electrical current surges.

2. The invention includes a novel protection structure for field emission elements, which deflects the discharge path of ionized gases away from the cathode, preventing surges in electrical current and burnout damage.

3. The protection structure includes multiple reduction plates or electrodes, typically on the cathode, which are elongated and parallel to rows of field emission elements, providing a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration to deflect the gas discharge path.

4. The protection structure is arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration among field emission elements, allowing for multiple reduction plates or electrodes to be interspersed, enhancing the protection against surges and burnout damage.

5. The protection structure is designed to substantially prolong the lifetime of field emission elements, reducing the likelihood of burnout damage.

6. The invention also includes a novel field emission display device with a protection structure, which includes a cathode, multiple field emission elements, and an operating voltage source, providing a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration among the field emission elements.

7. The protection structure is designed to deflect the gas discharge path of ionized gases away from the cathode, preventing surges in electrical current and burnout damage to field emission elements.

8. The invention also includes a novel field emission display device with a protection structure, which includes a cathode, multiple field emission elements, and an operating voltage source, providing a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration among the field emission elements.

9. The protection structure is designed to substantially prolong the lifetime of field emission elements, reducing the likelihood of burnout damage.

1. The present invention provides an image sensor comprising multiple imaging planes, where each imaging plane is formed on a different surface of the image sensor.
2. The image sensor includes a semiconductor substrate with opposed major surfaces and opposed edges between the surfaces, one of the edges having a surface receptive to light.
3. The image sensor includes an image sensor element formed in the substrate and located adjacent the one edge, the image sensor element including a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region in which charge carriers are generated by light impinging on the surface of the one edge.
4. The image sensor includes an elongated substrate of a P-type material, with an imaging plane on the top surface and imaging planes on two edge surfaces bordering the top surface.
5. The image sensor includes a P + layer formed in the top surface of the image sensor between each edge surface and the column of image sensor elements adjacent to the edge surface.
6. The image sensor includes an image sensing region and a charge collection and transfer means, with the charge collection and transfer means being a buried-channel CCD, and the image sensor element which functions with the top imaging plane including a photodiode in the image sensing region.

Summary 1: The invention provides methods for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device in a home network. The methods include receiving an instruction for a first device in an active power state and serving as a network master node to enter into a power management state, the first device adapted to perform a network administrative function while in an active power state, the power management state having a lower power consumption than the active power state; sending data from the first device to a second device serving as a network slave node, the data enabling the second device to start performing the network administrative function while in an active power state; and placing the first device into the power management state after sending the data.  
Summary 2: The invention also provides methods for managing power consumption in a home network, including receiving a request to send data from a first device serving as a network master node to a second device serving as a network slave node, the data enabling a network administrative function to be performed, and the second device adapted to perform the network administrative function while in an active power state; sending a request reply from the second device to the first device, the request reply indicating acceptance of the request to send the data; and receiving the data at the second device.

<summary>Background and Related Art</summary>
The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation. The prior art of UK 1449196 is described, which uses a triplet to define fixed angles in the elevation plane, within which angle measurements are made by other means. This invention extends these ideas to optimize angle measurements, using the triplet itself, notably over selected sectors at low elevation angles. The invention also aims to overcome ambiguity by providing unambiguous sector coverage and measurement accuracy. The array may operate in either receive or transmit mode, with the smallest number of antenna elements possible, with the lowest element not so close to the ground, and the highest antenna element at an acceptable height. The array is optimized for approximately the same elevation angles, so that amplitude S is at a maximum and altering slowly at angles where sensitive measurements are needed. The array is capable of giving very high angle measurement accuracy over each of its high amplitude regions. The invention also aims to provide a system for measuring the quotient {(A+C)/B}, which is squared, and to provide directional secondary surveillance radar interrogators that measure the range of identified aircraft.

<summary>Summary of the Field of the Invention</summary>

The invention relates to high-intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system and method of making an efficient high-intensity bulb and sleeve system having a liquid tight seal. The invention addresses the problem of subminiature lamps failing due to heat-induced degradation and the need for a longer bulb life by combating thermal cycling and chemical attack. The key features include a polymeric seal support that provides axial sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and improved resistance to chemical attack. The invention also includes a potting material for sealing the subminiature lamp glass envelope and a flexible polymeric seal support for axial positioning. The overall goal is to fabricate a seal supported lamp assembly with a liquid tight seal, minimizing the number of sealing points and maximizing the length of a seal surface. The invention also addresses medical subminiature lamps and other applications where insulation, high heat degradation resistance, solvent and chemical resistance are required.

The application described is a method for configuring a generalized decision feedback equalizer (GDFE) precoder in a base station of a multi-user multiple-input multiple-output (MU-MIMO) wireless system. The method significantly reduces computational costs while maintaining system capacity. It is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including future "4G" cellular networks. The described implementation relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix (S zz ) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise." This is the key component in conventional GDFE precoder design and requires extensive computational cost. The proposed method does not require channel reduction when the Input Covariance Matrix (S xx ) for downlink channel is rank deficient. The method also allocates equal power to all data streams, which may not be an effective technique for practical systems using a finite number of quantized bit-rates. The proposed technique is limited to invertible channel matrices, which may not always be the case.

1. The invention is a heat-dissipating fan and a housing thereof, which are mainly composed of a fan housing and an impeller. The fan housing includes an air inlet and an air outlet, and the air streams produced by the impeller can be effectively concentrated to the center and then blow to the center portion of the heat sink having the highest temperature when the heat sink is assembled with the heat-dissipating device. The air passage formed by the sidewall of the passage of the housing reduces gradually and evenly in its cross-sectional area, thus enhancing the air streams produced by the rotation of blades of the impeller and effectively concentrating the air streams to the center. The air inlet side of the housing extends radially outwardly so as to enlarge the intake area of the air streams, and the air outlet side extends radially outwardly so as to enlarge the discharge area of the air streams. The design of the sidewall of the passage at the air inlet side of the housing is preferably formed with an inclined portion or a beveled edge, and the inclined portion can greatly enlarge the intake airflow area and reduce noises of the turbulent flow produced owing to uneven intake airflow area of the conventional fan. The design of the sidewall of the passage at the air outlet side of the housing is preferably formed with an inwardly inclined portion from the air inlet side to the air outlet side of the housing, and the air streams can be concentrated toward the center to provide better heat-dissipating performance for the heat-dissipating device that requires concentrated air streams. The design of the sidewall of the passage at the air inlet side of the housing is preferably formed with an inwardly inclined portion from the air inlet side to the air outlet side of the housing, and the air streams can be concentrated toward the center to provide better heat-dissipating performance for the heat-dissipating device that requires concentrated air streams. The design of the sidewall of the passage at the air outlet side of the housing is preferably formed with an inwardly inclined portion from the air inlet side to the air outlet side of the housing, and the air streams can be concentrated toward the center to provide better heat-dissipating performance for the heat-dissipating device that requires concentrated air streams. The design of the sidewall of the passage at the air inlet side of the housing is preferably formed with an inwardly inclined portion from the air inlet side to the air outlet side of the housing

1. The electroluminescent display panel of the present invention is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including a first electrode layer, a first insulation layer, a first luminescent layer, a second luminescent layer, a second insulation layer, and a second electrode layer. The first luminescent layer is made of ZnS:Tb or ZnS:TbOF, and the second luminescent layer is made of ZnS:Mn. The second luminescent layer partially overlaps the first luminescent layer, forming a single layer portion and a double layer portion. The single layer portion emits green light at a low level voltage and the double layer portion emits lemon light which is a mixture of green and orange at a high level voltage.
2. The electroluminescent display panel of the present invention is simple in structure and at a low cost. It can be made in a single layer or a double layer, and the display color can be selectively displayed in a color including no visible red components or in a color including visible red components with a high luminance.
3. The electroluminescent display panel of the present invention can be used as an instrument panel for an automobile, where green light display is used at night time and lemon light display is used at day time. The green light display is comfortable for a driver especially at night time, and the lemon light has a high luminance to cope with sun light at day time.
4. The electroluminescent display panel of the present invention can be modified to change the display color by changing the driving voltage. The color purity can also be changed by selecting the width of the second luminescent layer.

Summary:
The invention provides an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, including a communication terminal, a connecting unit, a service server, and a method for Internet/network telephony. The terminal reproduces sound on a first electrical signal and records sound resulting in a second electrical signal, converts the second electrical signal into transmission data, representing sound for transmission, in a suitable data format, and converts received data into a first electrical signal, and handles and controls communication in accordance with a standardized Internet/network protocol, such as TCP/IP. The terminal further includes a wireless communications means for wireless near field communication with a connecting unit, and an optional speech recognition means for analyzing and interpreting sound for recording and transmission to identify commands. The terminal also includes a computing/processing unit for controlling and coordinating various parts, and a database for storing relevant information. The terminal also includes a service server for handling and controlling connections to a large number of users, and a chat-line function for hands-free communication with multiple terminals/users. The terminal is also equipped with an energy/power source and a microprocessor for managing the system.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

1. Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric materials are convenient but Pb and Bi are very reactive and diffuse into and through metals such as Pd or Pt, making it difficult to integrate them directly on Si.
2. A Ge buffer layer on Si oxidizes less readily and can be used to prevent or minimize the formation of a low dielectric constant layer.
3. An epitaxial Ge layer on Si provides a good buffer layer which is compatible with Si and also many oxides.
4. Unlike other buffer layers, Ge is a semiconductor (it can also be doped to provide a reasonably highly conductive layer) and is compatible with Si process technology.
5. The epitaxial growth of Ge on top of ferroelectric or high-dielectric constant oxide is much easier than Si which makes it possible to form three-dimensional epitaxial structures.
6. However, not all oxides are stable next to Ge. For example, all ferroelectrics containing Pb such as Pb(Ti,Zr)O (PZT) are not thermodynamically stable next to Ge (since PbO is not stable).

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

1. The invention provides a receiver input circuit that eliminates unwanted signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, achieving small signal behavior and using conventional components.
2. The circuit includes a control loop for amplification control, with the control signal derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage, and a second amplification control loop whose control signal is taken out prior to the mixer stage.
3. The first amplification control circuit avoids unwanted overloading of the mixer stage and/or varactor diodes, while the second control circuit avoids overloading of the mixer stage and frequency influences acting upon the oscillator due to powerful usable signals to which the receiver is tuned.
4. The third amplification control circuit supports the other control circuits, with a lower effective band width and signal response threshold than the second control circuit.
5. The input network 3 includes three reactance elements (3a, 3b, 3c) and a PIN diode 3d for controllable signal attenuation, with a preamplifier stage 4 with a bipolar transistor 4b in grounded-base circuits 16 and 17, a mixer and oscillator stage 6, an intermediate frequency filter 7 with the resonant circuit 18, and a rectifier circuit 8 and 9.
6. The signal-dependent direct signals obtained in the rectifier circuits 8 and 9 are smoothed by a capacitor 21 and directed to a controlled shunt resistor in the circuit section 10 as a control signal.
7. The PIN diode control circuit has the advantage of protecting the input circuit from negative influences caused by strong spurious signals, and it also has the advantage of reducing the amplification of the circuit during control.

1. The invention relates to a collaborative work-sharing environment between two or more parties over a telephone call, without complex setup processes.
2. The invention includes a system for initiating a collaborative work-share environment between two or more parties to a telephone call.
3. The system includes a collaboration indicator and a collaboration button.
4. The collaboration indicator is used to indicate the availability of network collaboration between multiple parties.
5. The collaboration indicator is illuminated when a party activates the collaboration button.
6. The invention allows for spontaneous setup of a shared workspace between two or more parties over a telephone call.
7. The invention is applicable to both two-party and multiparty collaboration scenarios.
8. The invention can be implemented in a system in a corporate LAN, WAN, or the Internet.
9. The invention can be implemented by remote computers connected over a network.
10. The invention can be implemented by a computer program operating on a computer.

1. The present invention is a method for processing pictures intended to insert an advertising clip at a point, called insertion point, between two pictures of a sequence of video pictures, called video sequence, comprising the following steps:
2. The method generates a salience map representing the salience of the video sequence before the insertion point, and generates, for each advertising clip of a set of advertising clips, a salience map, determining the degree of similarity between the salience map of the video sequence and the salience map of the advertising clip, selecting the advertising clip having the highest degree of similarity, and inserting the advertising clip selected into the video sequence at the insertion point.
3. The method also includes detecting a shot change in the video sequence, selecting the advertising clip at the point of the video sequence corresponding to this shot change, and inserting the advertising clip at the point of the video sequence.
4. The method also includes determining the degree of similarity between the salience map of an advertising clip and the salience map of the video sequence according to a first embodiment, and determining the degree of similarity between the salience map of an advertising clip and the salience map of the video sequence according to a second embodiment.
5. The method also includes determining the degree of similarity between the salience map of an advertising clip and the salience map of the video sequence according to a third embodiment, and determining the degree of similarity between the salience map of an advertising clip and the salience map of the video sequence according to a variant embodiment.
6. The method also includes selecting N maximum salience points from the salience map of the video sequence and N maximum salience points from the salience map of the advertising clip, and calculating the Euclidean distance between the points of the same order, and determining the degree of similarity for each of the advertising clips according to the first embodiment, the second embodiment, the third embodiment, and the variant embodiment.

Summary 1: The invention provides a recessed mask structure that reduces localized high electrical fields at intersections with lower electrical breakdown, in very small dimension semiconductor devices such as would be encountered in high speed and high density integrated circuit applications and chip interconnect structures with fine metal features and low dielectric constant insulators.
Summary 2: The invention also provides a recessed mask structure that allows for the formation of small dimension interconnections between difficult-to-use materials in semiconductor devices by moving interfaces away from high fields and controlling capacitance through use of only as much of a high capacitance contributing ingredient as essential.

1. The Downconverting Digitizer of this invention utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple down converting A/D converter.
2. By placing the sampler inside the predictive loop, the predictive loop filter can be implemented using DSP techniques, thus reducing the complexity of the overall converter.
3. The dynamic range performance of the digital predictive encoder of this invention is further extended by utilizing the digital output of the loop to generate the signal for controlling a variable gain amplifier placed at the front of the predictive loop input.
4. The DC offset performance of the converter is greatly enhanced through incorporation of an offset nuller digital signal processing element which provides an estimate of offsets introduced by various circuits.
5. The implementation of the predictive loop of this invention allows the predictive filter to be implemented using DSP techniques, thus reducing the complexity of the overall converter and adding flexibility in re-programming the predictive filter characteristics.

1. The invention relates to nanodimensional features on semiconductor nanotraces that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms or gas molecules.
2. Nanodimensional features are fabricated using nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes.
3. The fabrication sequence includes patterning gate electrodes, gate dielectric layers, and semiconductor nanotraces.
4. The nanodimensional features are used to form multiplex detection arrays with sensors for multiplex detection of selected analytes.
5. The nanodimensional features are used to detect changes in electrical characteristics of the nanotrace groups.
6. The nanodimensional features are used to fabricate arrays of semiconducting nanotraces in a controllable and regular pattern.

<summary>Advantages of the Process</summary>

1. The process provides an integrated IGCC power plant and CTL facility, offering economies of scale for capital and operating costs.
2. The wet gasification stage uses water as a carrier for solid feedstock, producing synthesis gas precursor at high pressure.
3. The dry gasification stage uses synthesis gas precursor as a carrier for solid feedstock, producing hydrocarbons.
4. The process benefits from the synergistic effects of dry- and wet gasification technologies.
5. The IGCC facility can supply combustion gas at pressures higher than 70 bar, while the dry gasification stage can supply synthesis gas precursor at pressures matching Fischer-Tropsch hydrocarbon synthesis requirements.
6. The process optimizes the use of steam for Fischer-Tropsch tail gas treatment, reducing the need for boiler feed water and improving overall energy efficiency.

1. The invention addresses the problem of oxide superconducting materials, particularly those made of metals, which are difficult to fabricate at room temperature due to the presence of oxygen in the oxide superconducting material.
2. The invention introduces a blocking film (passivation film) that is uniformly coated over the surfaces of the oxide superconducting material to prevent the removal of oxygen from that portion.
3. The blocking film is formed using a photo-CVD method, which excites a reactive gas using ultraviolet light for coating the film onto the film forming surface.
4. The invention uses a silicon nitride film, silicon oxide film, or aluminum film as the blocking film, and the thickness of the film is controlled to maintain the same oxygen density as in the internal portion.
5. The invention also uses a metal or semiconductor as the blocking film, such as aluminum, titanium, copper, barium, yttrium, or silicon, and the thickness of the film is controlled to maintain the same oxygen density as in the internal portion.

1. The present invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination.
2. The apparatus includes a base structure for stabilization and a clamping arrangement to grasp the foam sheet specimen without damaging it.
3. The foam sheet can be advanced through the apparatus a prescribed amount and a planar surface is provided for interaction with a cutting knife.
4. The apparatus employs a screw thread specimen advance mechanism to prepare repetitive samples with uniform thickness and parallel cut edges.
5. The hand nut is used to hold clamp bar 24 in place, allowing for precise alignment and cutting of foam samples.
6. The razor blade is used to sever foam samples, preserving the structure of individual cells and eliminating distortion during examination.
7. The method provided by the invention permits the examination of foam samples with at least two parallel cut sides, preserving the cell structure and allowing for even transmission of light during microscopic examination.

<summary>Motor Assembly and Force Transmission Structure</summary>
The motor assembly comprises a motor and a force transmission structure. The force transmission structure includes a drive plate and a shaft. The drive plate has a mounting hole and a shaft fitted to the mounting hole for rotation with the drive plate. The drive plate has a plurality of protrusions formed on a first side of the body and configured to engage with a driving member, the shaft further comprises a pinion configured to drive a driven member. The drive plate further comprises a plurality of ribs formed at an opposite second side of the body. The mounting hole and the toothed portion are Y-shaped. The drive plate is made of a plastics material. The damper is made of rubber. The shaft further comprises a pinion for driving a gear of a window lift system. The shaft is held captive within the mounting hole by a circlip located within a groove in the distal end of the toothed portion. The force transmission structure provides a stable and quiet operation for the motor assembly.

1. The present invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver.
2. The system includes an antenna, a radio frequency subsystem, and a baseband subsystem.
3. The mobile time reference is generated using a high frequency clock and a low frequency clock.
4. The mobile time reference includes a clock-phase signal, a chip-counter, a slot-counter, and a frame-counter.
5. The system maintains the mobile time reference using the low frequency clock when the high frequency clock is not available and continues to generate the mobile time reference using the high frequency clock and the maintained mobile time reference as a starting point.

<summary>Our invention provides an individually fitted helmet liner that can be fitted to a wearer's head rapidly and in a simple manner. It offers several key features: a flexible foam liner that can be adjusted to accommodate different head sizes, a simple manufacturing process, and a uniform and predictable structural design. The liner is also easy to refit to accommodate a changed head size, and it does not require trimming after fitting. Additionally, it is relatively simple and inexpensive to manufacture, and it resists the tendency to shift position on the wearer's head.</summary>

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The invention relates to a multiorifice structure and a method for fabricating such a structure. The multiorifice structure comprises a plurality of angularly disposed passages and a method for making the multiorifice structure. The structure is made by fusing concentric layers of solid rods interspaced with cylindrical members, and the method includes cutting the fused assembly into thin wafers with interstices formed between the fused layers of rods and cylindrical members. The thickness of the wafers is determined by the effective aperture of the interstices and is sufficient to impart to the fluid passing through the interstices a directional component parallel to the angular displacement of the rods with respect to the common axis of the structure. The invention also includes a flat multiorifice spray plate for a fuel injector valve in which the fuel passing through the spray plate is ejected at an angle which is a function of orifices distance from the center of the structure.

1. The present invention provides an improved radio telephone that can be connected to a PC and used as an improved IP telephone.
2. The invention enhances the radio telephone by selectively operating as either a conventional radio telephone or an improved IP telephone.
3. The enhanced radio telephone includes an internal speech coder which is implemented for low power consumption and allows it to be used with a relatively low-performance PC for effective IP telephony.
4. The enhanced radio telephone handset is connected via a cable to a serial or parallel port of a PC running a streamlined software telephony application.
5. The enhanced radio telephone is switched between ordinary wireless (e.g., cellular) operation and IP-telephone operation either manually (e.g., via a pushbutton on the radio handset) or automatically from the PC (e.g., via an option in the telephony application running on the PC).
6. The enhanced radio telephone is also used for wireless data communication in order to carry IP speech.

<summary>Summary of the Application</summary>

The application is a continuation of Ser. No. 08/737,546, now U.S. Pat. No. 5,908,332, which was filed on Dec. 12, 1996, and designated the U.S. The application focuses on a simplified connection system for high voltage cables, including an apparatus and/or a second high voltage cable consisting of a cable termination and a rigid insulator. The interface between the cable end and any accessory, between two cable ends or between two apparatus is generally applicable, resulting in a number of advantages, such as factory pretesting, reduction of installation time and cost, and simplified field testing. The stress cone design and dimensions would also be the same for all applications, the only variation being the diameter of the cable or apparatus entrance. The interface components do not include any gas or oil and, therefore, they cannot leak or explode. The outer cone concept over the inner cone concept has the advantage of a shorter solution outside an SF6 cubicle, and the substantially plane surface interconnection has the advantage of simplifying complete alignment of meeting surfaces without risking glow discharges. The compact design, lower material and installation cost, complete independence between gas insulated switchgear and cable installations, standardization, and the outer surface configuration of the rigid insulator with a conical interface surface are the key advantages of the invention.

Summary 1: The invention provides a fixing mechanism for a tool, comprising a tool, its frame, and a bushing-like tool holder. The fixing mechanism can be used in various types of robot applications for production, in the exchange of grippers or the like in other automatic devices, such as apparatus for transfer and treatment of pieces, in pneumatic tools, etc. The fixing mechanism can be used for fixing both the actual machining tool and its counterpart, i.e. the so-called cushion, to the tool holder in the frame of the machine tool. The tool-fixing mechanism according to the invention can be used for fixing both the actual machining tool and its counterpart, i.e. the so-called cushion, to the tool holder in the frame of the machine tool.

<summary>Switching Circuitry for High-Efficiency and Low-Emission Driver Circuits</summary>

<summary>Vehicle Battery Rebalancing and Charging Techniques</summary>

1. Vehicle battery rebalancing is performed to correct cell voltage imbalance conditions.
2. The voltage of each cell is measured and the cell with the minimum voltage is identified.
3. All other cells are bled down via resistive circuitry associated with each cell until the other cells have a measured voltage approximately equal to the minimum.
4. Continuous/periodic cell voltage measurements are taken during the bleed down process to monitor change in cell voltages.
5. Once all of the cell voltage readings are approximately equal, the battery is charged.
6. The algorithm for determining times associated with rebalancing/charging the battery of FIG. 1 is provided.
7. The algorithm for rebalancing/charging the battery of FIG. 1 is provided.
8. The cell capacity, cell energy content, and cell voltage needed to provide specified energy content are calculated.
9. The algorithm for determining the desired voltage is provided.

Summary:
The invention provides an AC-to-DC voltage converter as power supply for lamp, which converts an AC input voltage to a constant DC voltage at predetermined value set by potentiometer. The output lamp has neither low frequency flicker nor high frequency flicker, so the constant brightness light reduces eyes' fatigue to minimum level to prevent myopia. The constant brightness light can be set to comfortable value that has no intense light to hurt retina by adjusting dimming and feedback circuit. There is no electromagnetic radiation on output.

1. The invention provides a new approach to illumination maintenance in a confined space where the sources of illumination include both daylight and electric lamps.
2. The invention allows for variable and flexible daylight compensation without using separate sensing for each illumination zone.
3. The invention enables the integration of window treatments to achieve a preset lighting profile and minimize or eliminate sun glare.
4. The invention provides a closed loop system for controlling window shading devices, allowing for near optimal illumination control without requiring localized sensing for different parts of the space.
